intro: Maripa peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian maripa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Maripa peruviana is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky soils and mountainous areas.
